name: Early Behavioral Recognition
description: Identifying the subtle and overt warning signs of narcissistic individuals before they gain influence.

cards.title: Recognizing Superficial Charm
cards.description: Understanding how narcissists use charisma to disarm and manipulate.
bulletpoints: Narcissists often appear overly confident and charismatic early on.
They use excessive flattery and mirroring to establish trust quickly.
Sudden shifts in attitude can reveal an underlying manipulative intent.

cards.title: Identifying Entitlement and Grandiosity
cards.description: Detecting when someone exhibits excessive self-importance.
bulletpoints: Watch for individuals who demand special treatment without merit.
Grandiose self-narratives often mask insecurity and manipulation tactics.
They devalue others to sustain their illusion of superiority.

cards.title: Manipulative Storytelling
cards.description: How narcissists craft narratives to control perception.
bulletpoints: They retell stories in ways that make them seem flawless or victimized.
Inconsistencies in their stories often emerge over time.
Exaggeration and selective omission are key signs of manipulation.
